laws.full_text:
overnments continued the assault on non-compete agreements. Minnesota became the fourth state to completely ban non-compete agreements with employees. On July 1, 2023, Minnesota will join California, North Dakota, and Oklahoma in the small (but growing) group of states that impose a full ban. Minnesota’s law is the first total non-compete ban since Oklahoma banned them in 1890, more than 130 years ago! Hot on ement: Must be reasonable in duration, geographic scope, and activities prohibited
Spec e a period of time that the employee cannot work for a competitor after separating from employment.State governments continue to tighten restrictions on non-competes across the country. State laws in North Dakota and Oklahoma prohibit the enforcement of the contractsâand California doesnât recognize them at all.Many states also recognize their own non-compete standards.
